ARTICLE.TITLE: The Apprentice 2019: 'Very cut-throat' librarian Lottie Lion from Somerset to fight for £250,000 investment from Lord Sugar
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Somerset's top stories direct to your inbox Join for free Thank you for subscribing See our privacy notice Invalid Email

A "very cut-throat" librarian from Somerset will be among the 16 entrepreneurs hoping to become Lord Alan Sugar's new business partner.

Chaos is set to unfold as contestants undertake a number of team-based tasks under the watchful eyes of Karren Brady and Claude Littner.

This year's winner will receive a £250,000 investment from Lord Sugar in their business.

Lottie Lion, a 19-year-old librarian from Dulverton, will be seeking the businessman's backing in the new series of The Apprentice.

The teenager has said she is "very cut-throat" and is no pushover.

(Image: PA/BBC)

She believes her poise and "powers of persuasion" are her greatest business qualities, noting that people with bad manners anger her and she gets frustrated when things do not match her high standards.

She says: "I bring class to everything and ensure nothing I do is half-standard or tacky."

In an Instagram post, she added: "I am delighted to announce that I am a candidate on The Apprentice.

"Follow my trials and tribulations on task and in the boardroom as I compete to become Lord Sugar's business partner on BBC One, Wednesdays, nine o’clock."

The ambitious first episode of the new series will see contestants fly to Cape Town, South Africa for a challenging task.

In the following episodes, the apprentices will be tasked with running a corporate away-day on a steam train, designing a theme park ride, and creating an advertising campaign in Finland.

The Apprentice returns on Wednesday, October 2 at 9pm on BBC One.
